th

Ma
tie
heare thinketh that the wisdome of the States is such as theie will

o
n] to the vulgar people,
but will persist in theire fomer refusall whereof yowe did send

r
:
yet it is heare thowght meete that sum good advise showld be
geven to the States, and to the
Counsell of Estate
also, in what forme
and manner the awnsweare might be made
by

to this ende I have [sodenlie] made a drawght by waie of

It is here formed to direct yowe howe to proceede in this matter,
but Considering the Scoape hereof is vearie well liked of hir Ma
tye

yo
r
